go down.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to become lower in level, amount etc
go down.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: His income went down last year.
Computers have gone down in price.
go down.translation[0].definitions[1].de: if something goes down, its quality or standard gets worse
go down.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: This neighbourhood has really gone down in the last few years.
go down.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to get a particular reaction from someone
go down.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: His suggestion did not go down very well.
The movie went down very well in America.
The speech went down a treat with members  (=members liked it very much).
The idea went down like a lead balloon (=was not popular or successful).
go down.translation[0].definitions[3].de: if food or drink goes down well, you enjoy it
go down.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: I’m not that hungry so a salad would go down nicely.
go down.translation[0].definitions[4].si: go from one place to another
go down.translation[0].definitions[4].de: to go from one place to another, especially to a place that is further south
go down.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: We’re going down to Bournemouth for the weekend.
He’s gone down to the store to get some milk.
go down.translation[0].definitions[5].de: to go to the shops, a club etc
go down.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: Does anyone want to go down the pub tonight?
go down.translation[0].definitions[6].de: if a ship goes down, it sinks
go down.translation[0].definitions[6].ex: Ten men died when the ship went down.
go down.translation[0].definitions[7].de: if a plane goes down, it suddenly falls to the ground
go down.translation[0].definitions[7].ex: An emergency call was received shortly before the plane went down.
go down.translation[0].definitions[8].ex: The swelling will go down if you rest your foot.
go down.translation[0].definitions[9].de: if something that is filled with air goes down, air comes out and it becomes smaller and softer
go down.translation[0].definitions[10].d: to be recorded or remembered in a particular way
go down.translation[0].definitions[10].e: The carnival will go down in history (=be remembered for many years) as one of the best ever.
The talks went down as a landmark in the peace process.
go down.translation[0].definitions[11].d: to lose a game, competition, or election
go down.translation[0].definitions[11].e: The government went down by 71 votes.
go down.translation[0].definitions[12].d: to move down to a lower position in an official list of teams or players
go down.translation[0].definitions[12].e: United went down to the second division.
go down.translation[0].definitions[13].d: if a computer goes down, it stops working for a short time
go down.translation[0].definitions[13].e: If one of the file servers goes down, you lose the whole network.
go down.translation[0].definitions[14].d: if lights go down, they become less bright
go down.translation[0].definitions[14].e: The lights went down and the curtain rose on an empty stage.
go down.translation[0].definitions[15].d: when the sun goes down, it appears to move down until you cannot see it anymore
go down.translation[0].definitions[16].d: if the wind goes down, it becomes less strong
go down.translation[0].definitions[16].e: The wind had gone down but the night had turned chilly.
go down.translation[0].definitions[17].e: He went down for five years.
go down.translation[0].definitions[18].e: the type of guy who knows what’s going down
go down.translation[0].definitions[19].d: to leave Oxford or Cambridge University at the end of a period of study
go down.translation[1].definitions[0].de: if a computer or machine goes down, it stops working because of a fault
go down.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: If one of the file servers goes down, you lose the whole network.
